transcoding-sample.cc

The Sangoma implementation of the JSR309 API could be used to build an Audio Transcoding Server server. This example shows how to use the API in order to build such server.

The following scenario is a basic example of the Audio Transcoding Server application.

       A                T                B
       | (1) INVITE     |                |
       | -------------> |                |
       | (2) 200 OK     |                |
       |     Codec A    |                |
       | <------------- | (3) INVITE     |
       |                | -------------> |
       |                | (4) 200 OK     |
       |                |     Codec B    |
       |                | <------------- |
       |                |                |
       |  RTP Codec A   |  RTP Codec B   |
       | <------------> | <------------> |
       |                |                |
       | (5) BYE        |                |
       | -------------> |                |
       | (6) 200 OK     |                |
       | <------------- | (7) BYE        |
       |                | -------------> |
       |                | (8) 200 OK     |
       |                | <------------- |

When User Agent A (A) wants to call User Agent B (B), but there is no common codec they can use to talk directly to one another, A will send an INVITE (1) to the Transcoding Server (T). T will choose a codec from the list that matches its configuration and respond with a 200 OK (2). Then, T will INVITE B advertising all the codecs it can do (3). B will respond with a 200 OK selecting one of the codecs (4). Once the call is established on both sides, RTP packets coming from A will be transcoded by T to the codec chosen by B and vice versa.

In this scenario, the JSR309 API will be responsible of configuring the Media Server that will handle the RTP streams. An API usage example, citing the before-mentioned scenario, is illustrated below.

00066 #include <unistd.h>
00067 #include <iostream>
00068 #include <stdio.h>
00069 #include <boost/shared_ptr.hpp>
00070 
00071 #include <sangoma/defines.h>
00072 #include <sangoma/uuid.h>
00073 #include <sangoma/loggerlog4c.h>
00074 
00075 #include "jsr309/mscontrolfactory.h"
00076 #include "jsr309/mediasession.h"
00077 #include "jsr309/networkconnection.h"
00078 #include "jsr309/mediaconfig.h"
00079 #include "jsr309/event.h"
00080 #include "jsr309/eventlistener.h"
00081 
00082 using namespace sangoma::jsr309;
00083 using namespace std;
00084 
00085 #define LOG_INFO( _x ) do { cout << "INFO - " << _x << endl; } while(0)
00086 #define LOG_WARN( _x ) do { cout << "WARN - " << _x << endl; } while(0)
00087 #define LOG_ERROR( _x ) do { cerr << "ERROR - " << _x << endl; } while(0)
00088 
00089 
00090 class MyMediaServerLostListener 
00091     : public virtual sangoma::jsr309::MediaServerLostListener {
00092 public:
00093 
00094   MyMediaServerLostListener() {}
00095 
00096   virtual void OnEvent( const MediaServerLostEvent& SNG_UNUSED_PARAM(event)) {
00097     LOG_ERROR( "Received MediaServerLostEvent. Hanging up call.");
00098   }
00099 
00100   void EnableListener() {}
00101 
00102   void DisableListener() {}
00103 
00104   bool IsListenerEnabled() const { return true; }
00105 
00106 };
00107 
00108 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00109 {
00110 
00111   using ::boost::shared_ptr;
00112 
00113   if ( argc < 4 ) {
00114     LOG_INFO( "usage is: jsr309-transcoding-sample <config_file> " <<
00115               "<call_A_ip> <call_B_ip> <logger_properties_file (optional)>" );
00116     return 1;
00117   }  
00118 
00119   const char* config_file = argv[1];
00120   const char* a_leg_ip = argv[2];
00121   const char* b_leg_ip = argv[3];
00122 
00123   const char* logger_prop_file = "";
00124   if ( argc >= 5 ) {
00125     logger_prop_file = argv[4];
00126   }
00127 
00128   // Create logger
00129   std::auto_ptr<sangoma::Logger> jsr_logger( new sangoma::LoggerLog4c );
00130   if( !jsr_logger->Init("jsr309", sangoma::INFO_LOG_LEVEL, logger_prop_file) ) {
00131     LOG_ERROR( "Unable to initialize logger for JSR309 library." );
00132     return 1;
00133   }
00134   
00135   // Create MSControlFactory instance and intialize it
00136   LOG_INFO("Creating MSControlFactory..." );
00137   shared_ptr<MSControlFactory> pMSFactory(new MSControlFactory());
00138   if ( !pMSFactory->Init(config_file,jsr_logger.release()) ) {
00139     LOG_ERROR( "Unable to initialize MSControlFactory." );
00140     return 1;
00141   }
00142   
00143   // Receive INVITE from User Agent A (step 1)
00144   MediaConfig sdpOfferA; // comes from the INVITE
00145   sdpOfferA.SetIPAddress(a_leg_ip);
00146   sdpOfferA.SetRtpPort(14000);
00147   sdpOfferA.SetRtcpPort(14001);
00148   sdpOfferA.AddCodec("PCMU", 0 /*PCMU*/, 20, 8000, 0 );
00149   sdpOfferA.AddCodec(sangoma::Codec::PCMA, 8 /*PCMA*/, 20, 8000, 0 );
00150   sdpOfferA.SetRtcpFlag(true);
00151   sdpOfferA.SetCname("a-leg");
00152  
00153   // If the INVITE supports RFC2833, had the following lines, specifying the
00154   // payload type selected by your application. To be enabled, RFC2833 support
00155   // must alos be enabled in jsr309 config.xml file.
00156   sdpOfferA.SetRfc2833Flag(true);
00157   sdpOfferA.SetRfc2833Payload(101);
00158 
00159 
00160   // Create MediaSession
00161   LOG_INFO("Creating Media Session..." );
00162   shared_ptr<MediaSession> pMediaSession(pMSFactory->CreateMediaSession());
00163   if ( !pMediaSession ) {
00164     LOG_ERROR("Unable to create a Media Session.");
00165     return 1;
00166   }
00167 
00168   sangoma::jsr309::MediaServerLostListenerPtr listener(new MyMediaServerLostListener());
00169 
00170   if ( !pMediaSession->AddListener(listener) ) {
00171     printf("ERROR - Unable to register bad media server event listener.\n");
00172     return 1;
00173   }
00174 
00175   // Create NetworkConnection A
00176   LOG_INFO( "Creating Network Connection A..." );
00177   shared_ptr<NetworkConnection> pNCA(pMediaSession->CreateNetworkConnection());
00178   if( !pNCA ) {
00179     LOG_ERROR( "failed to create Network Connection A" );
00180     return 1;
00181   }  
00182 
00183   // Configure NC A
00184   LOG_INFO("Configuring Network Connection A with remote offer capacities...");
00185   if ( !pNCA->SetRemoteOffer(sdpOfferA) ) {
00186     LOG_ERROR( "Unable to configure Network Connection A.");
00187     return 1;
00188   }
00189 
00190   // Get the capacities from the Network Connection A to allow the application
00191   // to create an SDP answer.
00192   LOG_INFO( "Retrieving Network Connection A to build local answer...");
00193   MediaConfig sdpAnswerA;
00194   if (!pNCA->GetLocalAnswer(sdpAnswerA)) {
00195     LOG_ERROR( "Unable to get local answer configuration for Network " <<
00196               "Connection A." );
00197     return 1;
00198   }
00199 
00200   LOG_INFO( "Network Connection A listening port=" << sdpAnswerA.GetRtpPort());
00201   LOG_INFO( "Network Connection A prefered codec=" 
00202             << sdpAnswerA.GetCodecList().front().name());
00203 
00204   // Send 200 OK to A with Sdp NCA (step 2)
00205   
00206   // Create NetworkConnection B
00207   LOG_INFO("Creating Network Connection B..." );
00208   shared_ptr<NetworkConnection> pNCB(pMediaSession->CreateNetworkConnection());
00209   if( !pNCB ) {
00210     LOG_ERROR( "failed to create Network Connection B" );
00211     return 1;
00212   }  
00213   
00214   // Get the capacities from the Network Connection B to allow the application
00215   // to create an SDP offer.
00216   LOG_INFO( "Retrieving Network Connection B local capacities to build "
00217             "local offer..." );
00218   MediaConfig sdpOfferB;  
00219   if (!pNCB->GetLocalOffer(sdpOfferB)) {
00220     LOG_ERROR( "Unable to get local offer configuration for Network " <<
00221               "Connection B." );
00222     return 1;
00223   }
00224 
00225   LOG_INFO( "Network Connection B listening port=" << sdpOfferB.GetRtpPort());
00226   LOG_INFO( "Network Connection B prefered codec=" << 
00227             sdpOfferB.GetCodecList().front().name());
00228 
00229   // Send INVITE to User Agent B with Sdp NCB (step 3)
00230   
00231   // Receive 200 OK from B (step 4)
00232   MediaConfig sdpAnswerB; // comes from the 200 OK
00233   sdpAnswerB.SetIPAddress(b_leg_ip);
00234   sdpAnswerB.SetRtpPort(15002);
00235   sdpAnswerB.SetRtcpPort(15003);
00236   sdpAnswerB.AddCodec("PCMA", 8 /*PCMA*/, 30, 8000, 0 );
00237   sdpAnswerB.SetRtcpFlag(true);
00238   sdpAnswerB.SetCname("b-leg");
00239   
00240   // If the INVITE supports RFC2833, had the following lines, specifying the
00241   // payload type selected by your application. To be enabled, RFC2833 support
00242   // must alos be enabled in jsr309 config.xml file.
00243   sdpAnswerB.SetRfc2833Flag(true);
00244   sdpAnswerB.SetRfc2833Payload(101);
00245 
00246   // Configure NC B
00247   LOG_INFO( "configuring Network Connection B with remote answer..." );
00248   if ( !pNCB->SetRemoteAnswer(sdpAnswerB) ) {
00249     LOG_ERROR( "Unable to configure Network Connection B.");
00250     return 1;
00251   }
00252 
00253   // Join NC A and NC B
00254   //
00255   // Join method can be called on two Network Connection (all streams are
00256   // joined) or only on a specific stream (e.g. audio stream). 
00257   //
00258   // pNCA->GetJoinableStream(JoinableStream::kAudio).Join(
00259   //     Joinable::kDuplex,
00260   //     pNCB->GetJoinableStream(JoinableStream::kAudio));
00261   //
00262   // Along with the other Joinable, the Join() method also takes the direction
00263   // in which the join will take place. This parameter value can be
00264   //
00265   //   - Joinable::Direction::kDuplex: media flows in both directions between
00266   //   objects.
00267   //   - Joinable::Direction::kReceive: media flows into the object. In the
00268   //   example below, media would flow from pNCB into pNCA.
00269   //   - Joinable::Direction::kSend: media flows out of the object. In the
00270   //   example below, media would flow from pNCA into pNCB.
00271   //
00272   LOG_INFO( "joining Network Connections A and B..." );
00273   if ( !pNCA->Join(kDuplex, pNCB) ) {
00274     LOG_ERROR( "Unable to join Network Connection A to Network Connection B.");
00275     return 1;
00276   }
00277 
00278   // RTP is flowing from both sides
00279 
00280   // Sleep for 10 seconds to give the user time to check the streams
00281   string stop_cmd;
00282   cout << endl << "Press ENTER to terminate the session..." << std::endl;
00283   cin >> stop_cmd;
00284 
00285   // Receive a BYE from A (step 5) 
00286   // Unjoin NC A and NC B
00287   LOG_INFO( "unjoining Network Connections A and B" );
00288   if ( !pNCB->Unjoin(pNCA) ) {
00289     LOG_ERROR( "Failed to unjoin Network Connection A from Network "
00290               "Connection B.");
00291   }
00292 
00293   // Send 200 OK to A (step 6)
00294   
00295   // Send BYE to B (step 7)
00296   
00297   // Receive 200 OK from B (step 8)
00298 
00299   // shared_ptr will automatically cause the cleanup of MediaSession and its
00300   // NetworkConnections
00301 
00302   // Success
00303   return 0;
00304 }
